formalMetadata.description: A short text with an acronym; the expansion of the acronym is provided in the title attribute of the acronym element, but the expansion — as opposed to the acronym itself — is not well known.
formalMetadata.title: Acronym with obscure expansion in title attribute

recommendation.label: XHTML™ 1.0 The Extensible HyperText Markup Language (Second Edition)

testElement.specReference: Phrase elements: EM, STRONG, DFN, CODE, SAMP, KBD, VAR, CITE, ABBR, and ACRONYM

purpose.p: This test case is intended to pass because an expansion of the acronym is available, but many users may be unfamiliar with the expanded form and become confused.

userGuidance.p: In this test you will see a short text with an acronym (an abbreviation like cm for centimetre). The expansion of the acronym will appear by mouse hovering.

questionText.p: Was the mechanism of presenting the expansion adequate ?

optionOther.p: Please provide your comments in regard to possible difficulties with this presentation mechanism. Suggestions on improvements are welcome as well:
